alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 7:42PM AKST until January 15 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 55 below and blowing snow expected. Plan on areas of poor visibilities to create difficult travel conditions at times. Winds gusting to 30 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...From Point Lay west. * WHEN...Until noon Saturday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting to 30 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow. Cold wind chills to 55 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means periods of blowing snow will cause travel difficulties.
